Class DatabaseController

java.lang.Object
_3024c.heroregistry.controllers.DatabaseController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class DatabaseController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This contains all the logic for the database page its startup and button clicks on it page

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This is required to initialize all FXML pages and connect controllers
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • updateStatus

      public static void updateStatus(String message, boolean success)
      Static utility method to safely update the UI status from any static context. DatabaseController.updateStatus(...).

    • connectionToDatabase

      public void connectionToDatabase()
      connectionToDatabase() This method attempts to establish a connection to the database and stores it in the `dbConnection` instance field.

    • closeConnection

      public void closeConnection()
      Closes the database connection if it is open. This is crucial for preventing memory leaks.

    • performRead

      public static List<Hero> performRead()
      performRead() Read operation for database. This method uses the stored `dbConnection` to run a query. This uses PreparedStatement to read
      Returns:
      the list type is a list of Heroes from the DB

    • performCreate

      public static long performCreate(Hero hero)
      performCreate() Create operation for database. This method uses the stored `dbConnection` to run a query.This uses PreparedStatement to safely insert data.
      Parameters:
      hero - This hero object avoids using Id to not confuse the mySQL/Jakarta Blend into thinking this is an update
      Returns:
      a long of the id that was generated by the DBMS to be added to the record of the newly created record

    • performUpdate

      public static void performUpdate(Hero hero)
      performUpdate() Update operation for database. This method uses the stored `dbConnection` to run a query. This uses PreparedStatement to safely update data.
      Parameters:
      hero - the parameter is hero, The Object of the record to update*

    • performDelete

      public static void performDelete(Long id)
      performDelete() An example CRUD (Delete) operation. This method uses a PreparedStatement to safely delete data. from database
      Parameters:
      id - The parameter of id is the ID of the record to delete
